0.Major_Activities1: A team of doctors led by Prof Dr Swee Chong  from Singapore conducted free women s health check up, education and cervical cancer screening at hospital from 31 July 16 to 05 Aug 16.  Approximately 3000 patients have been examined during the camp.  Out of the above 300 patients have been treated through LIP and further advance treatment at SIIMS with kind help of Mr Bill Kite.   Bus services were provided for transportation of patients from far flung area of Ladakh by Mr Bill Kite.

registeration_info.nr_add: KIDAR HOUSE POLO GROUND LEH LADAKH

source_info.purpose: Health awareness camp with special emphasis to cervical can cer has been conducted at almost 150 villages of Leh district.  The camp has been conducted with support of Womens, Alliance of Ladakh Budhist Association.  Other topic covered during the campaign are quitting smoking, liquor and other related bad habits

On 17-18 July, 2016 an outdoor free medical camp for cervical screening has been carried oujt at Gya/Meru village, some 70 Kms away from Leh on Leh Manali Road by a group  of doctors from the US.  Approximately 300 patients have been examined during the camp. This year we have dedicated the medical camps to commemorate birth centenary of Padma Bhushan, HH Kushok Bakula Rinpochey, who had been the pioneer for education and other developments in Ladakh.

The fact that Leh is growing as a point of important tourism in the region, is signifying a growth in wasteand pollution issues for the ecosystem. For this reason we unite efforts with the District Administration of Leh (DC Avny Lavasa), SSP Leh Sargun Shukla (Jkp Leh), A Thousand Metres Above and other friends from Leh, and produced a documentary film called ‘Foe in Phayul’ that talks about the consumption in plastic and
the environmental impact of it.
